data.name: CopyRightText
data.value:
โปรแกรมนี้มีซอฟต์แวร์ฟรี คุณสามารถเผยแพร่ซ้ำ และ/หรือแก้ไขภายใต้เงื่อนไขของใบอนุญาตที่สาธารณะทั่วไป GNU ขณะที่เผยแพร่ โดยพื้นฐานซอฟต์แวร์อิสระ ทั้งสองเวอร์ชัน 3 หรือ (ทางเลือก) ของคุณมีรุ่นที่ใหม่กว่า
โปรแกรมนี้จะได้รับการกระจายในหวังว่า จะเป็นประโยชน์ แต่ไม่มีการรับประกันใด ๆ ไม่ มีแม้แต่โดยนัยรับประกันความสามารถเชิงพาณิชย์หรือความเหมาะสมสำหรับวัตถุประสงค์เฉพาะ ดูสิทธิ์การใช้งานประชาชนทั่วไปของ GNU สำหรับรายละเอียดเพิ่มเติม
คุณควรได้รับสำเนาของใบอนุญาตให้ใช้สาธารณะทั่วไป GNU พร้อมกับโปรแกรมนี้ ถ้าไม่ เขียนไปฟรีซอฟต์แวร์พื้นฐาน Inc., 51 ถนน Franklin ห้าผลิต บอสตัน MA 02110-1301, USA

data.name: HelpTIpsPerformanceText
data.value: - Open the video settings and increase the value of the option "Skip Frames (same emulation speed)". This option reduces the number of frames the emulator needs to display and therefore leaves more resources to keep the emulation speed up. The games might appear less smooth when increasing the frame skip value. - Open the sound settings and switch off audio synchronization. This might increase the performance, but the sound quality may suffer. - Open the sound settings and switch the sound completely off.

data.name: HelpTipsSoundText
data.value: - Open the sound settings and switch on audio synchronization. This might increase the audio quality, but the performance may suffer. - If the emulation speed is too low, the sound quality can also suffer. Follow the above tips for games that are running slowly.

data.name: HelpIssuesWhiteScreenText
data.value: - Make sure the downloads are completed before you leave the OneDrive import page (wait for confirmation message). If you leave too early, the ROMs may remain in a corrupted state and cannot load correctly. If this happens, delete them (tap and hold in the ROM list) and re-download. - If OneDrive import does not work or ROMs imported from OneDrive don't work in general, try other methods to import ROMs. There are 3 methods of importing ROMs (OneDrive, E-Mail, Web Browser) described in the "how to" section of this page. - Don't forget to delete the ROMs that don't work before you re-import them using another method.

data.name: HelpImportWebText
data.value: In your web browser, open any web site that offers ROM downloads and start the download of the desired game. If the download was a *.zip archive, the browser allows you to navigate through the archive when the download is done. Locate the *.gba file contained in the archive and tap on it to start the emulator. The emulator will automatically import the ROM you downloaded using your web browser. If the downloaded file was a *.gba file, just tap on it and the emulator will start and import the ROM.

data.name: EditText
data.value: แก้ไข

data.name: VirtualControllerButtonGray
data.value: gray

data.name: HelpTipsTurboText
data.value: - Press the camera button to toggle turbo mode. - Half-press the camera button to activate turbo mode while holding the camera button half-pressed.

data.name: ManageSaveTimeLabel
data.value: สร้างเมื่อ:

data.name: HelpImportSkyDriveText
data.value: Store your ROMs in a folder on your OneDrive. Afterwards navigate to the OneDrive section on the main page of the emulator (swipe left from the ROM list). If you are not signed in yet, click on "Sign in" first and enter your credentials if you are asked for it. When you are signed in, click on the button labeled "import ROMs" on the emulators main page. The following page allows you to navigate through OneDrive to locate the folder where you put your ROMs into. In the folder containing the ROMs, tap on any *.gba or *.zip file to start the download. Wait for the download to complete before you leave the page. A confirmation message will be shown when the download is completed. Note: In some cases, ROMs downloaded from OneDrive only show a blank screen when started. If you experience this issue, please use alternative 2 or 3.

data.name: HelpImportEmailText
data.value: Send an E-Mail to any E-Mail address that is accessible from your phone, containing one or more ROM(s) as file attachments. You can either attach the ROMs as *.gba files or contained within a *.zip archive. Open the E-Mail on your phone and tap on the attachment to download the file. If your attachment was a *.zip archive, the E-Mail client allows you to navigate through the archive. Locate the ROM inside the archive and tap on it to launch the emulator. The emulator will automatically import the ROM from the E-Mail attachment and start the game. If the attachment was not a *.zip archive but a *.gba file, just tap on it to start the emulator and import the ROM.
